message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of guarding simple polygons using mobile guards, which is a classic problem in computational geometry and falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also discusses the subclasses of orthogonal, monotone, and starshaped polygons, which are important topics in computational geometry and can be classified under discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper provides a set of answers to existence questions, which involves analyzing the combinatorial structure of the polygons and can be classified under graph theory (cs.GT). The paper also discusses the use of open and closed guards, which involves analyzing the behavior of the guards and can be classified under systems and control (cs.SI). Finally, the paper involves the use of algorithms and data structures to solve the problem, which can be classified under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
